snippet.textDisplay: I miss this game... my cousins stole it from me years ago and I haven't been able to get it back or find a copy ever since... I remember just playing this game simply to listen to the ending theme. My absolute favourite! It was also my second game after Tetris<3

snippet.textDisplay:
Boy is this a flashback to more simpler times.
I still have this game...and by today's standards it looks like one of those games you play onyour wristwatch. But the only difference was that this game was rad!
Reminds me of when I Iwas six trying this game out in FAO Schwarz at the mall. This thrilled me back then and it still does today. Certainly is a relic of those times that one cannot froget.
snippet.textOriginal:
Boy is this a flashback to more simpler times.
I still have this game...and by today's standards it looks like one of those games you play onyour wristwatch. But the only difference was that this game was rad!
Reminds me of when I Iwas six trying this game out in FAO Schwarz at the mall. This thrilled me back then and it still does today. Certainly is a relic of those times that one cannot froget.

snippet.textDisplay: To be honest, this has to be my favorite Mario game of all time. It's the one I had the most fun playing through beginning and end, almost bit off my finger because of the frustration this game caused me. But really good memories. Thanks for posting this.
